item.title: Race for ECB’s No. 2 Job Kicked Off by Euro-Area Finance Chiefs
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Euro-area finance ministers formally launched the process to find a successor to European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos, kicking off a two-year revamp of the institution’s Executive Board. The Eurogroup, which voted for Greece’s Kyriakos Pierrakakis as new president on T...

item.title: BlackRock’s Rieder Sees Bond Manager ‘Nirvana’ in European Debt
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- BlackRock is loading up on European bonds, using currency hedges to boost returns in what Rick Rieder calls “a nirvana for a bond manager.” Rieder, the chief investment officer of global fixed income for the world’s largest asset manager, said dollar-based investors can use currency h...

item.title: ECB Outlines Plans to Reduce Oversight Burden on Banks Next Year
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank will enact a raft of changes next year to make its supervision of lenders more effective and reduce costs for the industry. The ECB said it will speed up approval processes for straight-forward decisions on how banks use excess capital, including for some sha...

item.title: ECB’s Surprise AT1 Proposal, Short on Detail, Sows Confusion
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Investors in a key piece of bank capital were left puzzled after the European Central Bank proposed changing the market without explaining how. The idea to make so-called AT1 bonds more like equity capital came with “no details” on how that would work, KBW analysts led by Andrew Stimp...

item.title: London’s IPO Fortunes Brighten After Year-End Deals Rebound
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- A late burst of initial public offerings alleviated the UK’s deal drought this year, prompting optimism for a long-awaited recovery in 2026. Driving the comeback is a series of IPOs in the last two months: $539 million from Princes Group Plc, $531 million from bank Shawbrook Group Plc...

item.title: Portugal Is Ready to Back Centeno for ECB Vice President Job
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Portugal’s former central-bank Governor Mario Centeno is a potential contender to become the European Central Bank’s next vice president, according to the country’s finance minister. Centeno “is a possible candidate, but there is no official confirmation,” Joaquim Miranda Sarmento tol...

item.title: ECB Floats Tweaking AT1 Bank Capital to Better Absorb Losses
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank proposed changing the design of a type of deeply subordinated bond issued by lenders to ensure it can absorb losses before banks fail. Enhancing the features of additional Tier 1 capital would also provide extra clarity to lenders and investors and would be c...
